question: The difference between a single discount of 30% on 550 Rs. and two successive discounts of 20% and 10% on the same amount is :
explanation:
Case I : A single discount of 30%
Case II : Two successive discounts of 20% and 10%
Single equivalent discount
$latex = \\left ( 20+10-\\frac{20\\times 10}{100} \\right )\\%  = 28\\%&s=1$
Difference $latex = \\left ( 30 - 28 \\right )\\% = 2\\%$
âˆ´ Required Difference = 2% of 550
$latex = \\frac{2\\times 550}{100} = 11\\  Rs.&s=1$
Hence option [B] is correct answer.
